channel.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“djzone, post:32, topic:541444”][quote author=Strucker link=topic=660314.msg4471911#msg4471911 date=1423524750]

is it possible in the client to start a new thread and make it listen for when autoclicker program is opened?

It is, but it is extremely easy to get around or prevent it from working at all. Not to mention I don’t want some skid having access to any more than the cache.

if you JAR and obfuscate the client 9/10 no one will know that you will have added the feature
[/quote]i actually did listen for autoclicker sometime last year and it worked pretty fine

although this post is old, listening for the clicker is a dumb idea. what are you listening for? whether it contains autoclick?

ill change the clicker’s process name to tampon.exe. #bypassed[/quote]yeah, i did have some sort of spent time doing a list of executables, but, however, the user is not supposed to know this is added.
But whatever you’re right, it’s not a good idea.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @djzone djzone
item.description:
@djzone wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:31, topic:541444”][quote author=lare69 link=topic=660314.msg4470026#msg4470026 date=1422470273]

is it possible in the client to start a new thread and make it listen for when autoclicker program is opened?

It is, but it is extremely easy to get around or prevent it from working at all. Not to mention I don’t want some skid having access to any more than the cache.

if you JAR and obfuscate the client 9/10 no one will know that you will have added the feature
[/quote]i actually did listen for autoclicker sometime last year and it worked pretty fine[/quote]

although this post is old, listening for the clicker is a dumb idea. what are you listening for? whether it contains autoclick?

ill change the clicker’s process name to tampon.exe. #bypassed

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @Freesunfury Freesunfury
item.description:
@Freesunfury wrote:

Instead of actually doing anything that tells the player that they are being watched for clicking activity it would be more beneficial to send a log of users that are suspicious for auto activity.

EDIT: Also another thing you have to fix is that the person doesn’t go in one direction everytime. Reason… Someone can click something that has a low timer and can clip into objects.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:541444”]Why not just add in a random event? Adding some “cheat prevention” or “anti-auto-clicker” ain’t much. And you could just set the clicker to 4-5 seconds and not get caught.

1 line comments should look like:

[code=java]
// This
/* Or this /
/*

  • But not this!
    /[/code][/quote]
    If you couldn’t tell he actually documented his code. At which case /    * */ is appropriate.
    OT: good effort dude (: you’re getting there at least. [quote=“lare69, post:25, topic:541444”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=660314.msg4415785#msg4415785 date=1395835287]
    Could make a new packet which sends the mouse position on the game screen.
    [/quote]
    already exists[/quote]
    Packet 241

[quote=“Docent, post:19, topic:541444”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=660314.msg4415710#msg4415710 date=1395800113]
Shouldn’t you record the amount of clicks within a certain interval? Maybe a mass amount of clicks inside of a certain area.
[/quote]

Then the person will slow down the auto clicker and if he keeps editing the anti auto clicker script then normal people will get affected because you click a lot of you havent noticed.[/quote]
That is very true. Amount of clicks would hurt most normal players rather than ACs.(their not really bots…) The best way to counter Autoclickers would be through a random event of some sort. It doesn’t have to be a “real” one, it can be made up by you as well. Even if it is "type this command ::ul #rand#"
or something like “what is the first item in your inventory?”
::itis Coins
Make it a mini quiz show with random questions

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.source: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

I have one on my Mac that basically records position on screen, what type of click / key to press, so I can basically write scripts for anything. not to mention I could have just used applescript to make a simple macro.

again, stop worrying about the way macros are done. and just add randoms and shit.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:22, topic:541444”]jagex already records mouse position in the client I believe. just nobody uses it because it isn’t a great solution. or they’re too stupid to implement it

and the auto clickers that support random movement don’t alter the camera state whatsoever. they simply have an offset to the click.

though the camera movement would be a easy thing to add. say every x amount of clicks on the same object, (or same position if you use the system provided) then modify the camera packet a few pixels over in a direction.[/quote]
I had an auto clicker that supported key commands and shit. Once I set it up like to mine Pure Ess for me on runescape. I was able to key in to hit the d pad so the mouse could hit the bank and everything… So I mean, the tech is out there, and it ain’t hard to come by.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

jagex already records mouse position in the client I believe. just nobody uses it because it isn’t a great solution. or they’re too stupid to implement it

and the auto clickers that support random movement don’t alter the camera state whatsoever. they simply have an offset to the click.

though the camera movement would be a easy thing to add. say every x amount of clicks on the same object, (or same position if you use the system provided) then modify the camera packet a few pixels over in a direction.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:20, topic:541444”]Could make a new packet which sends the mouse position on the game screen. This along with recording the clicks to find patterns could flag cheaters.

Some autos support random mouse clicks in a certain area. If they’re random, this means that altering their camera position will cause their clicking to move from original object, so alter their camera state[/quote]Read this. It’s activated during log-in by setting the flagged variable to 1.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Could make a new packet which sends the mouse position on the game screen. This along with recording the clicks to find patterns could flag cheaters.

Some autos support random mouse clicks in a certain area. If they’re random, this means that altering their camera position will cause their clicking to move from original object, so alter their camera state

Read full topic

item.description:

wildskiller:

Shouldn’t you record the amount of clicks within a certain interval? Maybe a mass amount of clicks inside of a certain area.

Then the person will slow down the auto clicker and if he keeps editing the anti auto clicker script then normal people will get affected because you click a lot of you havent noticed.

You should take into account a lot more factors when writing it though.

item.title: [PI] Anti auto clicker, made this thinking of stalls
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:12, topic:541444”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=660314.msg4415260#msg4415260 date=1395604255]You could check to see if they click in the exact same spot multiple times, but that’s so easy to counter it’s not really worth it. Just add a random event.
[/quote]

This would be bad if I got more random events for being on a laptop, the mouse probably won’t move too much if I’m only thieving.[/quote]Didn’t say add a random event if their mouse doesn’t move, I just meant use a random event instead.
